result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keotha L Erickson

Defendant Keotha L Erickson not in court.  Attorney Jacob Hilton in court for Keotha L Erickson.  Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Notice to Person Posting Bond Money

Total Bond covers all files 21CM682 and 22CM415.
Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any co-actor(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  CO-ACTOR(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH ANTHONY TAYLOR. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

Case called. Appearances made. 
Prosecuting attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Keotha L Erickson in court, in custody.  Attorney Jacob Hilton in court for Keotha L Erickson. 
Atty Hilton waives reading of complaint; Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved. Bond in 21CM682 to cover 22CM415. 
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court 
Court in recess.
Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
